Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @sikkan you mine KMD with Z9/A9 asics. Much better for the environment, because one of these asics replaces dozens of GPU cards yet costs a fraction of the price of the GPUs 👼

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: KMD is mineable with exactly the same hardware as ZEC, ZEN, HUSH and whichever other coins still use equihash (200,9) params

Author: sikkan#6377
Content: @dukeleto I hear you 😃 and I dont agree on that environment thing.. sure, its more efficient than a GPU, but if asics werent manufactured we would "only" have GPUs running the network. What happens now is that ASICs take over the network and GPUs move to another algo 😉

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Several projects have implemented their own 51% attack protection.  Pirl and Loki come to mind.  The main difference is ours is extendable to 3rd party chain and is a piece of the puzzle to crosschain communication and interoperability,  Other projects competing with Komodo with its extendability to 3rd party chains are far behind, namely due to bad engineering.  Veriblock’s Proof of Proof is an order of magnitude more expensive and Blockstack requires coin burn. Komodos DPoW costs regenerate at least in part.

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Those extendable competitors also don’t have cross chain communication component as part of their offering

Content:
Is there a certain spam protection with the Blockchain Starter Kit?

Author: jorian#4555
Content: the amount of chains possible within KMD platform is so huge it's not worth the time. even if you have a chain with name CHAIN, you can create a different blockchain by specifying a different  `-ac_reward` for example. also, the name of the `ac_name` parameter has a pretty high char limit

Author: jorian#4555
Content: as for hosting stuff, yes, i guess some limits need to be in place
